text:
Opened svgviewer first time.
Set the css file to use to 'f:/sgml/svg/svg.css' using the browse button

Quit the application.

started it again.
Complained about the css file (unable to resolve path?)
Refused to start. Leaves the intro screen up. 

Unable to clear the error.
Unable to find where the file location is stored.

Uninstalled the whole of batik.
Re-installed.
the app retains the preference for the css file,
hence batik is now unusable on this machine.

Request that I be informed how I can remove the 'ini file' or
whatever retains the link to the css stylesheet to allow re-use
of batik.

Regards DaveP.
ps, whilst it was running, I liked it.
creator: dpawson@rnib.org.uk
hillion@apache.org
text:
To delete the Batik init files:

  - Search for a .batik directory somewhere on you main drive (perhaps is it 
somewhere in the winnt directory or in 'Program File\Login\'

  - Remove it.

Perhaps you could delete these files when batik is uninstalled?
Then users would not be locked out and prevented from further
use of batik.

Regards DaveP
creator: dpawson@rnib.org.uk
